Resting

Core game system for short and long rests

Short Rest

A Short Rest is a 1-hour period of downtime, during which a character does nothing more strenuous than eating, drinking, reading, and tending to wounds.

Benefits:

  • Spend Hit Dice to regain hit points
  • Some class features recharge (e.g., Fighter's Second Wind)
  • Roll Hit Dice: 1d6, 1d8, 1d10, or 1d12 (based on class) + Constitution modifier

Long Rest

A Long Rest is an extended period of downtime—at least 8 hours—during which a character sleeps or performs only light activity.

Benefits:

  • Regain all lost hit points
  • Regain spent Hit Dice (up to half your maximum)
  • Regain all spell slots
  • Reduce Exhaustion level by 1
  • All class features recharge

Limitations:

  • You can't benefit from more than one Long Rest in a 24-hour period
  • You must have at least 1 hit point at the start to gain benefits
